result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie L. Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and any sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and any sentence currently serving

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie L. Shoemaker

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:34 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1335 and 22CF827.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Julie Lennon. 

Date and time set for waiver of preliminary hearing (22CF827) and plea/sentencing in both cases; VRCW. 

Wavier of Prelim 22CF827>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information has been e-filed. 

Plea/Sentencing>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed on both cases.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CF1335: 
State moves to DRI>>
Count 3 (Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony/Repeater/PTAC); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony/Repeater/PTAC); COURT grants. 
Count 7 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater/PTAC); COURT grants. 
Count 9 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater/PTAC); COURT grants. 
Count 10 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 11 (Possession of THC/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 12 (Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 13 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 14 (Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 15 (Possession of THC/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 16 (Possession of Controlled Substance/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 17 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 18 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 19 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 20 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 21 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 22 (Possession of Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater); COURT grants.

22CF827: 
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin <3g/Repeater); COURT grants.  

PLEA>>

21CF1335: 
Count 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>10-50g)/Repeater): GUILTY.  
Count 2 (Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs (>10-50g)/Repeater): GUILTY.  
Count 5 (Possess w/Intent/Deliver Prescriptions/PTAC/Repeater): GUILTY. 
Count 6 (Chronic Neglect of a Child/PTAC/Repeater): GUILTY.  
Count 8 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater/PTAC): GUILTY.  

22CF827: 
Count 2 (Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance/Repeater): GUILTY. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS>>

21CF1335: Count 1 and 2>>10 years WI State Prison (5 years IC/5 years ES).  
21CF1335: Count 5 and 6>>6 years WI State Prison (3 years IC/3 years ES). 
21CF1335: Count 8>>3.5 years WI State Prison (1.5 years IC/2 years ES). 

22CF827:  Count 2>>3.5 years WI State Prison (1.5 years IC/2 years ES).  

All counts concurrent to each other and any sentence currently serving.  

CONDITIONS of ES:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.  

COURT grants 294 days credit on 21CF1335 and 14 days credit on 22CF827.

Adj:  11:02 a.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): J.M.W. and with D.A.C., D.J.C., M.G. and G.H. unless approved by DSS.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No possession of firearms.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
